text:
Inna Vladimirovna Makarova (; 28 July 1926 – 25 March 2020) was a Russian actress. She is best known for her role as Lyubov Shevtsova in "The Young Guard" (1948). Her other movie credits include "It Happened in the Donbass" (1945), "The Return of Vasili Bortnikov" (1953),"The Rumyantsev Case" (1956), "The Height" (1957), "Balzaminov's Marriage" (1964), "Russian field" (1971), "It Is Not Evening Yet" (1973) and "Dead Souls" (1984). In 1985, she was made a People's Artist of the USSR.
Makarova was born in Tayga and grew up in Novosibirsk. She was married to Sergei Bondarchuk. Her daughter was actress Natalya Bondarchuk. She died in Moscow on 25 March 2020 at the age of 93.
